USA: Thomas Dudley succeeded John Endecott as governor of the Massachusetts Bay Colony.
William Bradford (Plymouth Colony governor) succeeded Edward Winslow as governor of the Plymouth Colony.
Taiwan: The Chinese are forbidden from hunting deer in Taiwan
Russia: Michael died. His son, Alexis I, succeeded him.
Philippine: The Colegio de Santo Tomas raised to the status of a university and renamed as University of Santo Tomas by Pope Innocent X, upon the request of King Philip IV of Spain.
Estonia: Saaremaa (Ösel) island was ceded from Denmark to Sweden by the Treaty of Brömsebro.
China: Yangzhou massacre: Qing forces conquered Yangzhou from the Southern Ming. A ten-day massacre began in which some eight hundred thousand people would be killed.
Chile: Repopulation of Valdivia and construction of the Valdivian Fort System, Valdivia becomes part of Viceroyalty of Peru.
Barbados: The colony became re subdivided into eleven parishes, each sending two representatives to the House of Assembly.
